verses.verse: Now the day <WH3117> came <WH1961> that Jonathan, <WH3083> the son <WH1121> of Saul, <WH7586> said <WH559> to the young <WH5288> man <WH5288> who was carrying <WH5375> his armor, <WH3627> "Come <WH1980> and let us cross <WH5674> over <WH5674> to the Philistines' garrison <WH4673> that is on yonder <WH5676> side. <WH5676>" But he did not tell <WH5046> his father.

And Saul <WH7586> was staying <WH3427> in the outskirts <WH7097> of Gibeah <WH1390> under <WH8478> the pomegranate <WH7416> tree <WH7416> which <WH834> is in Migron. <WH4051> And the people <WH5971> who <WH834> [were] with him [were] about six <WH8337> hundred <WH3967> men, <WH376>

and Ahijah, <WH281> the son <WH1121> of Ahitub, <WH285> Ichabod's brother, <WH251> the son <WH1121> of Phinehas, <WH6372> the son <WH1121> of Eli, <WH5941> the priest <WH3548> of the Lord <WH3068> at Shiloh, <WH7887> was wearing <WH5375> an ephod. <WH646> And the people <WH5971> did not know <WH3045> that Jonathan <WH3083> had gone. <WH1980>

And between <WH996> the passes <WH9278> by which <WH834> Jonathan <WH3083> sought <WH1245> to cross <WH5674> over <WH5674> to the Philistines' garrison, <WH4673> there was a sharp <WH8127> crag <WH5553> on the one <WH2088> side, <WH5676> and a sharp <WH8127> crag <WH5553> on the other <WH2088> side, <WH5676> and the name <WH8034> of the one <WH259> was Bozez, <WH949> and the name <WH8034> of the other <WH259> Seneh. <WH5573>
The one <WH259> crag <WH8127> rose <WH4690> on the north <WH6828> opposite <WH4136> Michmash, <WH4363> and the other <WH259> on the south <WH5045> opposite <WH4136> Geba. <WH1387>

Then Jonathan <WH3083> said <WH559> to the young <WH5288> man <WH5288> who was carrying <WH5375> his armor, <WH3627> "Come <WH1980> and let us cross <WH5674> over <WH5674> to the garrison <WH4673> of these <WH428> uncircumcised; <WH6189> perhaps <WH194> the Lord <WH3068> will work <WH6213> for us, for the Lord <WH3068> is not restrained <WH4622> to save <WH3467> by many <WH7227> or <WH176> by few. <WH4592>"

And his armor <WH3627> bearer <WH5375> said <WH559> to him, "Do <WH6213> all <WH3605> that is in your heart; <WH3824> turn <WH5186> yourself, [and] here <WH2009> I am with you according to your desire. <WH3824>"
Then Jonathan <WH3083> said, <WH559> "Behold, <WH2009> we will cross <WH5674> over <WH5674> to the men <WH376> and reveal <WH1540> ourselves to them.
"If <WH518> they say <WH559> to us, 'Wait until <WH5704> we come <WH5060> to you'; then we will stand <WH5975> in our place <WH8478> and not go <WH5927> up to them.

"But if <WH518> they say, <WH559> 'Come <WH5927> up to us,' then we will go <WH5927> up, for the Lord <WH3068> has given <WH5414> them into our hands; <WH3027> and this <WH2088> shall be the sign <WH226> to us."

And when both <WH8147> of them revealed <WH1540> themselves to the garrison <WH4673> of the Philistines, <WH6430> the Philistines <WH6430> said, <WH559> "Behold, <WH2009> Hebrews <WH5680> are coming <WH3318> out of the holes <WH2356> where <WH834> <WH8033> they have hidden <WH2244> themselves."

So the men <WH376> of the garrison <WH4673> hailed <WH6030> Jonathan <WH3083> and his armor <WH3627> bearer <WH5375> and said, <WH559> "Come <WH5927> up to us and we will tell <WH3045> you something. <WH1697>" And Jonathan <WH3083> said <WH559> to his armor <WH3627> bearer, <WH5375> "Come <WH5927> up after <WH310> me, for the Lord <WH3068> has given <WH5414> them into the hands <WH3027> of Israel. <WH3478>"

Then Jonathan <WH3083> climbed <WH5927> up on his hands <WH3027> and feet, <WH7272> with his armor <WH3627> bearer <WH5375> behind <WH310> him; and they fell <WH5307> before <WH6440> Jonathan, <WH3083> and his armor <WH3627> bearer <WH5375> put <WH4191> some to death <WH4191> after <WH310> him.

And that first <WH7223> slaughter <WH4347> which <WH834> Jonathan <WH3083> and his armor <WH3627> bearer <WH5375> made <WH5221> was about twenty <WH6242> men <WH376> within about half <WH2677> a furrow <WH4618> in an acre <WH6776> of land. <WH7704>

And there was a trembling <WH2731> in the camp, <WH4264> in the field, <WH7704> and among all <WH3605> the people. <WH5971> Even <WH1571> the garrison <WH4673> and the raiders <WH7843> trembled, <WH2729> and the earth <WH776> quaked <WH7264> so that it became <WH1961> a great <WH430> trembling. <WH2731>

Now Saul's watchmen <WH6822> in Gibeah <WH1390> of Benjamin <WH1144> looked, <WH7200> and behold, <WH2009> the multitude <WH1995> melted <WH4127> away; <WH4127> and they went <WH1980> here <WH1988> and [there.]

And Saul <WH7586> said <WH559> to the people <WH5971> who <WH834> [were] with him, "Number <WH6485> now <WH4994> and see <WH7200> who <WH4310> has gone <WH1980> from us." And when they had numbered, <WH6485> behold, <WH2009> Jonathan <WH3083> and his armor <WH3627> bearer <WH5375> were not [there.]

Then Saul <WH7586> said <WH559> to Ahijah, <WH281> "Bring <WH5066> the ark <WH727> of God <WH430> here. <WH5066>" For the ark <WH727> of God <WH430> was at that time <WH3117> with the sons <WH1121> of Israel. <WH3478>

And it happened <WH1961> while <WH5704> Saul <WH7586> talked <WH1696> to the priest, <WH3548> that the commotion <WH1995> in the camp <WH4264> of the Philistines <WH6430> continued <WH1980> and increased; <WH7227> so Saul <WH7586> said <WH559> to the priest, <WH3548> "Withdraw <WH622> your hand. <WH3027>"

Then Saul <WH7586> and all <WH3605> the people <WH5971> who <WH834> [were] with him rallied <WH2199> and came <WH935> to the battle; <WH4421> and behold, <WH2009> every <WH376> man's sword <WH2719> was against his fellow, <WH7453> [and there was] very <WH3966> great <WH1419> confusion. <WH4103>

Now the Hebrews <WH5680> [who <WH834>] were with the Philistines <WH6430> previously, <WH865> <WH8032> who <WH834> went <WH5927> up with them all <WH5439> around <WH5439> in the camp, <WH4264> even <WH1571> they also <WH1571> [turned] to be with the Israelites <WH3478> who [were] with Saul <WH7586> and Jonathan. <WH3083>

When all <WH3605> the men <WH376> of Israel <WH3478> who had hidden <WH2244> themselves in the hill <WH2022> country <WH2022> of Ephraim <WH669> heard <WH8085> that the Philistines <WH6430> had fled, <WH5127> even <WH1571> they also <WH1571> pursued <WH1692> them closely <WH1692> in the battle. <WH4421>
So the Lord <WH3068> delivered <WH3467> Israel <WH3478> that day, <WH3117> and the battle <WH4421> spread <WH5674> beyond <WH5674> Beth-aven.

Now the men <WH376> of Israel <WH3478> were hard-pressed on that day, <WH3117> for Saul <WH7586> had put <WH422> the people <WH5971> under <WH422> oath, <WH422> saying, <WH559> "Cursed <WH779> be the man <WH376> who <WH834> eats <WH398> food <WH3899> before <WH5704> evening, <WH6153> and until <WH5704> I have avenged <WH5358> myself on my enemies. <WH340>" So none <WH3808> <WH3605> of the people <WH5971> tasted <WH2938> food. <WH3899>
And all <WH3605> [the people of] the land <WH776> entered <WH935> the forest, <WH9194> and there was honey <WH1706> on the ground. <WH6440> <WH7704>

When the people <WH5971> entered <WH935> the forest, <WH9194> behold, <WH2009> [there was] a flow <WH1982> of honey; <WH1706> but no <WH369> man put <WH5381> his hand <WH3027> to his mouth, <WH6310> for the people <WH5971> feared <WH3372> the oath. <WH7621>

But Jonathan <WH3083> had not heard <WH8085> when his father put <WH1> the people <WH7650> under <WH5971> oath; <WH7650> therefore, he put <WH7650> out the end <WH7971> of the staff <WH7097> that [was] in his hand <WH4294> and dipped <WH3027> it in the honeycomb, <WH2881> <WH3295> and put <WH1706> his hand <WH7725> to his mouth, <WH3027> and his eyes <WH6310> brightened. <WH5869>

Then one <WH376> of the people <WH5971> answered <WH6030> and said, <WH559> "Your father strictly <WH1> put <WH7650> the people <WH7650> under <WH5971> oath, <WH7650> saying, <WH7650> 'Cursed <WH559> be the man <WH779> who <WH376> eats <WH834> food <WH398> today. <WH3899>'" And the people <WH3117> were weary. <WH5971>

Then Jonathan <WH3083> said, <WH559> "My father has troubled <WH1> the land. <WH5916> See <WH776> now, <WH7200> how <WH4994> my eyes <WH3588> have brightened <WH5869> because <WH215> I tasted <WH3588> a little <WH2938> of this <WH4592> honey. <WH2088>

"How <WH637> much <WH637> <WH3588> more, <WH637> <WH3588> if <WH3863> only the people <WH5971> had eaten <WH398> freely <WH398> today <WH3117> of the spoil <WH7998> of their enemies <WH340> which <WH834> they found! <WH4672> For now <WH6258> the slaughter <WH4347> among the Philistines <WH6430> has not been great. <WH7235>"
And they struck <WH5221> among the Philistines <WH6430> that day <WH3117> from Michmash <WH4363> to Aijalon. <WH357> And the people <WH5971> were very <WH3966> weary. <WH5888>

And the people <WH5971> rushed <WH5860> greedily <WH6213> upon the spoil, <WH7998> and took <WH3947> sheep <WH6629> and oxen <WH1241> and calves, <WH1121> <WH1241> and slew <WH7819> [them] on the ground; <WH776> and the people <WH5971> ate <WH398> [them] with the blood. <WH1818>

Then they told <WH5046> Saul, <WH7586> saying, <WH559> "Behold, <WH2009> the people <WH5971> are sinning <WH2398> against the Lord <WH3068> by eating <WH398> with the blood. <WH1818>" And he said, <WH559> "You have acted <WH898> treacherously; <WH898> roll <WH1556> a great <WH1419> stone <WH68> to me today. <WH3117>"

And Saul <WH7586> said, <WH559> "Disperse <WH6327> yourselves <WH6327> among the people <WH5971> and say <WH559> to them, 'Each <WH376> one <WH376> of you bring <WH5066> me his ox <WH7794> or his sheep, <WH7716> and slaughter <WH7819> [it] here <WH2088> and eat; <WH398> and do not sin <WH2398> against the Lord <WH3068> by eating <WH398> with the blood. <WH1818>'" So all <WH3605> the people <WH5971> that night <WH3915> brought <WH5066> each <WH376> one <WH376> his ox <WH7794> with him, and slaughtered <WH7819> [it] there. <WH8033>
And Saul <WH7586> built <WH1129> an altar <WH4196> to the Lord; <WH3068> it was the first <WH2490> altar <WH4196> that he built <WH1129> to the Lord. <WH3068>

Then Saul <WH7586> said, <WH559> "Let us go <WH3381> down <WH3381> after <WH310> the Philistines <WH6430> by night <WH3915> and take <WH962> spoil <WH962> among them until <WH5704> the morning <WH1242> light, <WH216> and let us not leave <WH7604> a man <WH376> of them." And they said, <WH559> "Do <WH6213> whatever <WH3605> seems good <WH2896> to you." So the priest <WH3548> said, <WH559> "Let us draw <WH7126> near <WH7126> to God <WH430> here. <WH1988>"

And Saul <WH7586> inquired <WH7592> of God, <WH430> "Shall I go <WH3381> down <WH3381> after <WH310> the Philistines <WH6430>? Wilt Thou give <WH5414> them into the hand <WH3027> of Israel <WH3478>?" But He did not answer <WH6030> him on that day. <WH3117>

And Saul <WH7586> said, <WH559> "Draw <WH5066> near <WH5066> here, <WH1988> all <WH3605> you chiefs <WH6438> of the people, <WH5971> and investigate <WH3045> and see <WH7200> how <WH4100> this <WH2088> sin <WH9128> has happened <WH1961> today. <WH3117>

"For as the Lord <WH3068> lives, <WH2416> who delivers <WH3467> Israel, <WH3478> though <WH3588> <WH518> it is in Jonathan <WH3083> my son, <WH1121> he shall surely <WH3588> <WH4191> die. <WH4191>" But not one <WH369> of all <WH3605> the people <WH5971> answered <WH6030> him.

Then he said <WH559> to all <WH3605> Israel, <WH3478> "You shall be on one <WH259> side <WH5676> and I and Jonathan <WH3083> my son <WH1121> will be on the other <WH259> side. <WH5676>" And the people <WH5971> said <WH559> to Saul, <WH7586> "Do <WH6213> what <WH2896> seems good <WH2896> to you."

Therefore, Saul <WH7586> said <WH559> to the Lord, <WH3068> the God <WH430> of Israel, <WH3478> "Give <WH3051> a perfect <WH8549> [lot.]" And Jonathan <WH3083> and Saul <WH7586> were taken, <WH3920> but the people <WH5971> escaped. <WH3318>
And Saul <WH7586> said, <WH559> "Cast <WH5307> [lots] between <WH996> me and Jonathan <WH3083> my son. <WH1121>" And Jonathan <WH3083> was taken. <WH3920>

Then Saul <WH7586> said <WH559> to Jonathan, <WH3083> "Tell <WH5046> me what <WH4100> you have done. <WH6213>" So Jonathan <WH3083> told <WH5046> him and said, <WH559> "I indeed <WH2938> tasted <WH2938> a little <WH4592> honey <WH1706> with the end <WH7097> of the staff <WH4294> that was in my hand. <WH3027> Here <WH2009> I am, I must die! <WH4191>"
And Saul <WH7586> said, <WH559> "May God <WH430> do <WH6213> this <WH3541> [to me] and more <WH3254> also, <WH3541> for you shall surely <WH4191> die, <WH4191> Jonathan. <WH3083>"

But the people <WH5971> said <WH559> to Saul, <WH7586> "Must Jonathan <WH3083> die, <WH4191> who <WH834> has brought <WH6213> about <WH6213> this <WH2088> great <WH1419> deliverance <WH3444> in Israel <WH3478>? Far <WH2486> from it! As the Lord <WH3068> lives, <WH2416> there shall not one hair <WH8185> of his head <WH7218> fall <WH5307> to the ground, <WH776> for he has worked <WH6213> with God <WH430> this <WH2088> day. <WH3117>" So the people <WH5971> rescued <WH6299> Jonathan <WH3083> and he did not die. <WH4191>
Then Saul <WH7586> went <WH5927> up from pursuing <WH310> the Philistines, <WH6430> and the Philistines <WH6430> went <WH1980> to their own place. <WH4725>

Now when Saul <WH7586> had taken <WH3920> the kingdom <WH4410> over <WH5921> Israel, <WH3478> he fought <WH3898> against all <WH3605> his enemies <WH340> on every <WH5439> side, <WH5439> against Moab, <WH4124> the sons <WH1121> of Ammon, <WH5983> Edom, <WH9000> the kings <WH4428> of Zobah, <WH6678> and the Philistines; <WH6430> and wherever <WH3605> <WH834> he turned, <WH6437> he inflicted <WH7561> punishment. <WH7561>
And he acted <WH6213> valiantly <WH2428> and defeated <WH5221> the Amalekites, <WH6002> and delivered <WH5337> Israel <WH3478> from the hands <WH3027> of those who plundered <WH8154> them.

Now the sons <WH1121> of Saul <WH7586> were Jonathan <WH3083> and Ishvi <WH3440> and Malchi-shua; and the names <WH8034> of his two <WH8147> daughters <WH1323> [were these: ] the name <WH8034> of the first-born Merab <WH4764> and the name <WH8034> of the younger <WH6996> Michal. <WH4324>

And the name <WH8034> of Saul's wife <WH802> was Ahinoam <WH293> the daughter <WH1323> of Ahimaaz. <WH290> And the name <WH8034> of the captain <WH8269> of his army <WH6635> was Abner <WH74> the son <WH1121> of Ner, <WH5369> Saul's uncle. <WH1730>
And Kish <WH7027> [was] the father of Saul, <WH1> and Ner <WH7586> the father of Abner <WH5369> [was] the son <WH1> of Abiel. <WH74>

Now the war <WH4421> against <WH5921> the Philistines <WH6430> was severe <WH2389> all <WH3605> the days <WH3117> of Saul; <WH7586> and when Saul <WH7586> saw <WH7200> any <WH3605> mighty <WH1368> man <WH376> or any <WH3605> valiant <WH2428> man, <WH1121> he attached <WH622> him to his staff.
